title: alecano38
author: alecano38
content: I have some Ipollo B1L with 60 Th/s they have 4  3.12A FANs with 7400 rpm. All hashboards never exceed 65C. So I want to know what do you think about replacing the four of my other S19jpro that came with 2.7A and 6000 RPM, cause when I have some hot days of around  temp 28/30C the Chiptemps rise to  around 80C. Besides Ipollos has different disipation config inside, do you think I will see an improvement of lowering the temp if I replace the 4 FANS from 2.7A to 3.12A ?? any possible current problem on circuits??? anyone has ever done this kind of replacement?? thanks a lot for the reply

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: If the fan from apollo is compatible to s19j pro with 7400 rpm then it should work but I do not know if the fan will run normally because I heard someone from Reddit replace the fan from other models into antminer units the result become abnormal RPM like 6000rpm it turns to 60,000rpm.There are two different fans the brushless and the ball-bearing one Bitmains recommends only brushless fans.If you want to cool down the miner a bit when hot days then I suggest run the miner at low power mode and make sure you have proper way to take the hot air out from the room like adding ventilation and exhaust so that the hot air on the room do not stuck.

comments.author: alecano38
comments.body: nice answer. How can I switch the miner to low power mode?? or I must change the firmware? under modes I only has Normal mode and Sleep mode !

comments.author: unicornmangle
comments.body: blockchain is so dull and boring we have posts about fans again to make mystery out of how cooling works like its some big mystery how air cools hot and how the chips require a certain temperature to operate because the stupid mfg said so. throw your miner in the garbage.

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: Quote from: alecano38 on March 29, 2023, 03:45:47 AMnice answer. How can I switch the miner to low power mode?? or I must change the firmware? under modes I only has Normal mode and Sleep mode !bitmain has a low power firmware download for your miner.

comments.author: TalkativeCoin
comments.body: Quote from: alecano38 on March 29, 2023, 03:45:47 AMnice answer. How can I switch the miner to low power mode?? or I must change the firmware? under modes I only has Normal mode and Sleep mode !Yes, you can find that firmware here - https://m.bitmain.com/support/download
